captions.text: I've travelled all around Europe but in fact I prefer Greece
For me Greece it's a little bit paradise on earth
It's a wonderful country

You know I've travelled before but I've never seen something like 
 this you know it's beautiful it's island it's crazy
This is the perfect summer holiday destination to come to
One of the most beautiful places I've been in my entire life
This is the best vacation spot that you can ever dream of
Sea is lovely, the beach is lovely

Il mare 
the sea of course
I adore the sea
I love it uhm it's very peaceful and restful and very blue
The sea is gorgeous
If you want to get a tan you should come here
The sea is very clear
Clean, very very clean
There's nothing that compares these beaches

There are some beautiful coasts in the area 
 with sort of quite water it's fantastic
The beaches, the nightlife everything is fantastic
The nightlife in Greece makes NY City look like a sleepy town
So very loud and very lifey
You guys definitely know how to enjoy yourselves
It's just very luxurious I think just being here
The pools, the beach, the spa, the shopping everything looks lovely
The Spa is amazing, it gives you all the facilities and all the treatments would you need to relax and to really really enjoy the wellness

For the money that we paid, we received 
 everything and even more than we expected
The facilities here are amongst the best in Europe
You can go hiking, you can go biking, you can go horseback riding
For the Diving in Greece what we have here is usually fantastic conditions

The kids have everything to do
She learned waterski
even my wife (I did) learned mono-ski
We like to go canoeing, Yeah!
Greece is a good place for a family
And they have really good food
The Greek food ah! It's yummy, it's gorgeous
I think there is a fine art to eating in Greece
Lots of fresh fruits and vegetables
Better prepared than in many other countries
The country has been very beautiful and the people are very very friendly
The Greek people are probably the friendliest in Europe
Most people can speak English so its good for us
They've been really welcoming
We live the Culture in Greece and we live the History
I like visiting old Ancient Sites

Its cool to just be able to go so 
 far back in time in places like this
This is the birth of Western Civilisation
His middle name is Pericles what more do you want?
You can't beat the culture and the landscape
We haven't missed our home at all
I don't want go home
I will come back here
Oh yeah, definitely come back
I'll definitely come back
I don't want to leave
It was worth coming
I've had the time of my life in Greece

comments.text:
indeed a beautiful promo video. but i think the scenery and landscape lends 
itself for better colour grading in post production.﻿

comments.text:
(i'm from greece) If you're planing to come , pleaaaseeee DON'T TROW YOURE 
TRUSH EVERYWERE BECAUSE a lot of times i see people  really don't caring 
and some of the times i said something to theme really gently and they were 
like ''why sould i care? i'm leaving next week'' or other times something 
like that... Just please... DON'T MAKE ME KILL YOU  O.O﻿

comments.text:
The blood that pulsates through my veins comes from this sacred land the 
Gods chose to grace...

"Except the blind forces of nature, nothing moves in this world which is 
not Greek in its origin."
(Εκτός των τυφλών δυνάμεων της φύσεως, τίποτα δεν κινείται σε αυτόν τον 
κόσμο που να μην είναι Ελληνικό στις καταβολές του)

Sir Henry James Sumner Maine﻿

comments.text: I was in Samos last week, it was empty.
comments.author: milli park

comments.text:
Well, since Crete is the biggest greek island one week might not be enough 
to explore everything!! The only thing for sure is that you're not going to 
get bored!! Do not miss Chania (very picturesque city), Mallia (crazy 
nightlife, many brits go there) and Knosos (archeological site). There are 
many other places, and plenty of beautiful beaches, you should ask and 
search on the internet. Thanks for your words and I hope you have a 
pleasant stay!
comments.author: anicks1908

comments.text:
Unfortunately, we already have our flights booked! Since we only have one 
week, and because of the vast distance, I think we’ll have to find other 
sights and activities to entertain us. Hopefully, in the future we will 
return to Greece and visit Athens. I’ve been researching other things for 
us to do... between water parks, museums, aquariums, bars, nightclubs, boat 
tours, and shopping, I’m beginning to think we won’t have enough time to 
sleep! I can't wait to visit your beautiful country!
comments.author: Ciara McGirl

comments.text:
..or you can spend only a few hours in Athens by taking this sightseeing 
bus (it's similar to those they have in London but with no roof on the top) 
which tours around the most important sites. So you can have a taste of 
Athens without losing much time..
comments.author: anicks1908

comments.text:
Hmm Crete is a bit far and travelling from Athens to Crete or the opposite 
by boat will cost you a lot of time. You can come to Athens, spend a couple 
of days sightseeing and then go to Crete by plane which is less than 1 
hour, or do the opposite. I live in Athens and I would say u should 
definately see it but if you have only 1 week for the whole vacation it 
might be tiring as you will be on the rush...It's up to you!
comments.author: anicks1908

comments.text:
I'll be spending one week on the island of Crete with some 3 of my best 
friends! I'd love to see Athens but I think it may be to far away? Any tips 
or advice for me? : ))
comments.author: Ciara McGirl
